content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Magdeburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello Mister Wang, it's my pleasure to have you here. I'm sure you'll find the apartment to be a great fit for your needs. So, what price were you considering for the rental?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I appreciate the quality of the apartment and the central location. However, as a student, I'm looking to find the best deal possible. I'm willing to pay a fair price that reflects the value of the apartment. Would you be willing to consider a lower rate?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Mister Wang, I understand that as a student, you're looking for the best deal. However, this is a brand-new apartment in the city center, which naturally comes with a higher price point. I'm not sure how much lower I can go without compromising on the rent. Can you provide me with a price that you think is fair?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I respect the investment you've made in this apartment. A fair price, in my opinion, would be one that reflects the quality of the apartment while also considering my budget as a student. Would you be amenable to a price around 800 Euro per month?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I'm sorry, but 800 Euro per month is below my market value for this apartment. It's a brand-new, unfurnished unit in the city center, which typically commands a higher price. I'm looking for a tenant who values the quality and location and is willing to pay a price that reflects that. How about we start with a price closer to 1000 Euro per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your starting point is quite high for a student budget. Could we perhaps find a middle ground? I'm willing to pay a bit more than 800 Euro, but not quite at the 1000 Euro mark. Would you be willing to meet me halfway?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Mister Wang, I'm willing to negotiate, but halfway between 800 and 1000 Euro would still be quite a bit lower than my asking price. How about we meet at 900 Euro per month? This would be a fair compromise, considering the quality and location of the apartment. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your offer of 900 Euro per month is closer to what I'm looking for. However, as a student, I'm still hoping to find a price that's a bit more within my budget. Would you consider going down to 850 Euro per month? This would make the apartment more accessible to me.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Mister Wang, I'm trying to be fair with you, but 850 Euro per month is significantly lower than what I believe this apartment is worth. The location and quality justify a higher price. How about we meet at 875 Euro per month? This is the lowest I'm willing to go for such a prime property. Would you agree to this price?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your offer of 875 Euro per month is more aligned with my budget as a student. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Would it be possible to include some utilities in this price, such as heating or water? This would help further reduce my expenses.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I'm sorry, but I cannot include any utilities in the price. The rent is for the apartment alone, and all utilities such as heating, water, and electricity will be the tenant's responsibility. This is a standard practice in the German rental market. With that in mind, do you agree to the price of 875 Euro per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
